VP Finance.name: Jude Dartey
VP Finance.introduction: Hello everyone, my name is Jude Dartey and I am running to be the VP of Finance for Class Board 2021. I would appreciate your support and please feel free to reach out to me at judartey@sas.upenn.edu if you have any questions or concerns

platform points: Continue the financial aid program for all class board related events and apparel
Engineering Chair.name: Joey Abdo
Engineering Chair.introduction: My name is Joey and I am a senior from New Jersey studying Systems Engineering in SEAS. I am running for engineering chair to work with the class board to have an amazing senior year filled with as many fun events and good times as the climate allows.

Nursing Chair.name: Tommy Seaman
Nursing Chair.introduction: Hey Seniors! Since our freshmen year I have had the pleasure of serving as the Nursing Chair and have worked with my fellow Class Board members to plan enjoyable events for the Class of 2021 and specifically the nursing class. During this unprecedented time, I will continue finding ways for our class to stay connected in this virtual setting. I will also make sure plans are in place to have a hopefully incredible spring semester with Feb Club, Hey Day, and more. Let’s make our last year at Penn Nursing one to remember!

Executive VP.name: Anthony Scarpone-Lambert
Executive VP.introduction: Hi Class of 2021! It's scary to think we are already seniors... I feel like yesterday was NSO. It's been a pleasure serving as your Executive Vice President this year and I'm so excited to be running for re-election. COVID may have forced us to have virtual classes this semester, however, I will continue to work hard to ensure it doesn't stop us from having the fun (and safe) senior year we deserve. Hey Day, Feb Club, and more... coming soon! Reach out if you have any suggestions, comments, or questions about our senior year! (Insta: @anthonyscarponelambert).

College Chair.name: Daniel Gordon
College Chair.introduction: Hello Class of 2021! It has been my absolute pleasure to be your College Chair for the past three years. Even with the restrictions surrounding this year, I will work diligently to make our senior year an amazing experience. If you have any suggestions/ideas, I would love to hear from you at dagord@sas.upenn.edu. I’m excited to share another wonderful year with you all!

College Chair.name: Charles Curtis-Thomas
College Chair.introduction: Hey​ ​everyone!​ ​My​ ​name​ ​is​ ​Charles​ ​Curtis-Thomas​, ​and​ ​I’m​ ​running​ ​for​ ​College Chair.​ ​I’ve​ ​met many​ ​of​ ​you​ ​over​ ​the​ ​past​ ​few​ ​years​,​ ​and​ ​​I​ feel like I've made a family with you all at Penn.​ ​30​ ​years​ ​from​ ​now,​ ​I​ ​want to​ ​look​ ​back​ ​on​ ​the​ ​Class​ ​of​ ​2021​ ​as​ ​one of the​ ​greatest​ ​classes​ ​in​ ​Penn’s​ ​history.​ ​I’m​ ​excited​ ​to​ ​finish our senior year together in these tough times, and work​ ​with​ ​you​ ​to​ ​help​ ​improve​ ​our already​ ​impressive​ ​community.​ ​If​ ​you​ ​want​ ​Penn​ ​to​ ​be​ ​the​ ​best​ ​it​ ​can​ ​be,​ ​express​ ​your​ ​right​ ​and vote​ ​for​ ​CCT.

platform points: Plan an incredible Feb Club: the thing I was most excited for throughout being on Class Board has been Feb Club senior spring, and it's my top priority this year
Make sure Hey Day is back and better than ever: it's disappointing that we never had Hey Day junior year, but it's a priority to have a similar experience in-person this spring
Be a voice for seniors that are away from campus: I'm currently the only member on CB that's living outside of Philadelphia for the semester permanently
Wharton Chair.name: Jay Mudholkar
Wharton Chair.introduction: What’s up everyone! My name is Jay Mudholkar, and I’m running for re-election for Wharton Chair on Class Board. Literally can’t believe it’s been three years since I first joined, but the experience has been incredible: from Econ Scream freshman year, to U-Night sophomore year, to P-Sweaters junior year, I’ve loved every minute of it and deciding to run was one of my best decisions at Penn. My goal for senior year on Class Board is to make the absolute most out of our modified senior year events, and help plan an unreal spring.

President.name: Lizzie Youshaei
President.introduction:
So...if second semester last year didn't really happen, can we just pretend we're not seniors?? #whendidwegetsoold

Class of '21, never did I think that we'd be celebrating our senior year like this, but if there is any class to make the most of this situation, it's ours. And the best part is that we still have so much time to celebrate, laugh and create memories together. This includes getting to celebrate our much awaited traditions like Hey Day, Feb Club, and Oktoberfest --- We are committed to that, no matter when that my be. 

It's been a great honor to serve as your class president these last two years and I can't wait for what is in store. I promise to continuously fight for our class, using this platform to amplify your voices. Thank you for this opportunity, it's been the greatest honor serving a class that is filled with people as amazing as yourselves. 

(air) hugs and love (from a distance), 
Lizzie

platform points: Ensuring the safety and health of the Class of 2021 on campus (testing, preventative guidelines)
Making sure students are able to access education wherever they are (Wifi, financial assistance)
Creating virtual Class of 2021 programming to make sure we can all still have fun for our senior year (game nights, escape rooms … anything else?) 😊
VP Internal.name: Seung (Sophia) Kim
VP Internal.introduction: Hi! My name is Sophia Kim but most people call me Skim. I’m so excited to be RE-RUNNING as your VP of Internal Affairs for the fourth time in a row! With the virtual nature of our fall semester, I know the Class of 2021 will be facing a unique year ahead: navigating classes over Zoom, keeping in touch with friends over Facetime- all while juggling various responsibilities in real life. Though challenging, I'm ready to adapt my organization and managing skills within Class Board 2021 to put forth the best possible memories for our senior year.
